title: Scroll to top of Careers page on navigation

requirements.text: Ensure that navigating to the /careers route from any other page scrolls the browser viewport to the top of the page. Implement a scroll-to-top effect in the CareersPage component (frontend/src/pages/CareersPage.tsx) using a useEffect hook that calls window.scrollTo(0, 0) on mount, so the page always loads at the top regardless of scroll position on the originating page.

quotes: when i click on the word careers from any other page, it takes me there but not to the top of the page. please fix

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking the Careers link from the home page navigates to /careers and the page is scrolled to the top.
Clicking the Careers link from the Resources page navigates to /careers and the page is scrolled to the top.
Clicking the Careers link from any other page navigates to /careers and the page is scrolled to the top.
The scroll-to-top behavior triggers on every mount of CareersPage, not just the first visit.
No other page or component behavior is changed.

constraints: Only modify frontend/src/pages/CareersPage.tsx â€” do not change routing configuration, Header, Footer, or any other component.
Do not alter any existing content, styling, or JSON-LD structured data in CareersPage.tsx.
nonGoals: Adding scroll-to-top behavior to any page other than CareersPage.
Modifying the TanStack Router configuration or route definitions.
Changing navigation links in the Header or Footer.
